Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
when you run the daemon from terminal, you'll get like: `RFOX: p2p.32268 rpc.32269 magic.4406ad4c 1141288268 1000000000 coins`
the magic for stratum would be `4cad0644` -- magic = 4 hex values and in the stdout, they are 'reversed' because of endian

Author: HashUnlimited#9427
Content: magic for stratum?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: as for -pubkey, it gets ignored when using stratum, because the stratum builds the equivalent of a rawtransaction

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: @HashUnlimited most nomp forks use "magic" to decode P2P connections

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: aka "pchMessageStart"

Author: HashUnlimited#9427
Content: which is pretty much deprecated as it comes with a nice blocknotify. in fact most daemon will get you the blocks and kick you

Author: HashUnlimited#9427
Content: if you like to go down that road of hacks, you need to make sure to fake the correct service bits as well

Author: HashUnlimited#9427
Content: Which NOMP isnâ€™t doing so itâ€™s treated like an SPV client

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: it's about a 50:50 split on which is faster: P2P or notify

Author: HashUnlimited#9427
Content: we will serve you blocks if we got a semaphore available, otherwise look somewhere else.
